style="margin-top:8pt"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging style="margin-top:8pt;text-align:right"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Emerging growth company&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<ix:nonNumeric contextRef="c-1" name="dei:EntityEmergingGrowthCompany" format="ixt-sec:boolballotbox" id="f-32">&#9744;</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><div Act.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#9744;</span></div><div style="margin-top:8pt;text-align:center"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr style="height:3pt"><td colspan="3" style="border-bottom:3pt double #000;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="height:18pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><span><br/></span></div></div></div><div id="i34eda43d2a1b465b865674bbbf065f7a_7"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"/><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div><span><br/></span></div></div><div style="-sec-extract:summary"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:107%">Item 1.01. Entry Into A Material Definitive Agreement</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">On <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="c-1" name="dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate" format="ixt:date-monthname-day-year-en" id="f-35">August&#160;29, 2023</ix:nonNumeric>, 3M Company (&#8220;3M&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) and 3M&#8217;s wholly-owned subsidiary Aearo Technologies LLC (together with certain of its related entities, the &#8220;Aearo Entities&#8221;) entered into a settlement arrangement (the &#8220;Settlement&#8221;) which is structured to promote participation by claimants and is intended to resolve, to the fullest extent possible, all litigation and alleged claims involving the Combat Arms Earplugs (CAE) sold or manufactured by the Aearo Entities and/or 3M, including claims that are part of multi-district litigation (MDL) in the Northern District of Florida and, separately, claims in the coordinated state court action in Minnesota, as well as potential future claims.  </span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">Pursuant to the Settlement, reached through the mediation process that the Company has previously disclosed, 3M will contribute a total amount of $6.01 billion between 2023 and 2029, which is structured under the Settlement to include $5.01 billion in cash consideration and $1 billion in 3M common stock, par value $0.01 per share.  The actual amount, payment terms, and dates are subject to satisfaction of certain participation thresholds claimants must meet, including that at least 98% of individuals with actual or potential litigation claims involving the CAE (calculated as described in the Settlement) must have enrolled in the Settlement and provided 3M with a full release of any and all claims involving the CAE.  </span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">The Settlement contemplates that the shares of 3M common stock to be issued in the Settlement, if and when issued, will be issued in reliance on the exemption from registration provided by Section 3(a)(10) of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. </span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">The Settlement provides that 3M does not admit any liability or wrongdoing.</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">The foregoing description of the Settlement is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of the master settlement agreements, copies of which are filed as Exhibits 10.1, 10.2 and 10.3 hereto and incorporated by reference herein. </span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div id="i34eda43d2a1b465b865674bbbf065f7a_72"></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:112%">Item 3.02 Unregistered Sales of Equity Securities</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">The information set forth in Item 1.01 is hereby incorporated by reference into this Item 3.02.  </span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div id="i34eda43d2a1b465b865674bbbf065f7a_10"></div><div style="-sec-extract:summary"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:107%">Item 8.01 Other Events</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">On <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="c-1" name="dei:DocumentPeriodEndDate" format="ixt:date-monthname-day-year-en" id="f-36">August&#160;29, 2023</ix:nonNumeric>, 3M issued a press release announcing the entry into the Settlement (filed as Exhibit 99.1 hereto and incorporated herein by reference). As a result of the Settlement, the Company will record a pre-tax charge of approximately $4.2 billion in the third quarter of 2023, representing the $5.3 billion pre-tax present value of contributions under the Settlement net of 3M&#8217;s existing accrual of approximately $1.1 billion related to this matter. This charge will be reflected as an adjustment in arriving at 3M&#8217;s results, adjusted for special items.</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Forward-Looking Statements</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">This report contains certain forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, including projections as to the amount and timing of payments made under the Settlement and statements regarding the potential impact of the Settlement on the existing litigation relating to the products that are the subject of the Settlement. You can identify these statements by the use of words such as "anticipate," "estimate," "expect," "aim," "project," "intend," "plan," "believe," "will," "should," "could," &#8220;would,&#8221; "target," "forecast" and other words and terms of similar meaning in connection with any discussion of future operating or financial performance or business plans or prospects. Forward-looking information is based on management&#8217;s estimates, assumptions, and projections, and is subject to significant uncertainties and other factors, many of which are beyond 3M&#8217;s control. Important risk factors could cause actual future results and other future events to differ materially from those currently estimated by management, including, but not limited to, whether the anticipated  participation by plaintiffs in  the Settlement will be achieved, whether the number of plaintiffs that participate in the Settlement will meet current expectations or will fall below the level that would permit 3M to terminate the Settlement (and whether 3M will elect to terminate the Settlement if this occurs), whether there will be a significant number of future claims by plaintiffs that decline to participate in the Settlement, whether the Settlement is appealed or challenged, whether the requirements applicable to the issuance of the equity securities that are contemplated to be part of the Settlement will be met, the filing of additional, or the outcome of any other pending or future, litigation relating to the products that are the subject of the Settlement, or changes in related laws or regulations. Additional important risk factors that could cause future actual results or events to differ materially are the following: (1) worldwide economic, political, regulatory, international trade, geopolitical, capital markets and other external conditions and other factors beyond the Company's control, including inflation, recession, military conflicts, natural and other disasters or climate change affecting the operations of the Company or its customers and suppliers; (2) risks related to unexpected events such as the public health crises associated with the coronavirus (COVID-19) global pandemic; (3) foreign currency exchange rates and fluctuations in those rates; (4) risks related to certain fluorochemicals, including liabilities related to claims, lawsuits, and government regulatory proceedings concerning various PFAS-related products and chemistries, as well as risks related to the Company's plans to exit PFAS manufacturing and discontinue use of PFAS across its product portfolio; (5) legal proceedings, including significant developments that could occur in the legal and regulatory proceedings described in </span></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><span><br/></span></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"/><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div><span><br/></span></div></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">the Company's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended Dec. 31, 2022 and any subsequent quarterly reports on Form 10-Q (the "Reports"); (6) competitive conditions and customer preferences; (7) the timing and market acceptance of new product and service offerings; (8) the availability and cost of purchased components, compounds, raw materials and energy due to shortages, increased demand and wages, supply chain interruptions, or natural or other disasters; (9) unanticipated problems or delays with the phased implementation of a global enterprise resource planning (ERP) system, or security breaches and other disruptions to the Company's information technology infrastructure; (10) the impact of acquisitions, strategic alliances, divestitures, and other strategic events resulting from portfolio management actions and other evolving business strategies; (11) operational execution, including the extent to which the Company can realize the benefits of planned productivity improvements, as well as the impact of organizational restructuring activities; (12) financial market risks that may affect the Company's funding obligations under defined benefit pension and postretirement plans; (13) the Company's credit ratings and its cost of capital; (14) tax-related external conditions, including changes in tax rates, laws or regulations; (15) matters relating to the proposed spin-off of the Company's Health Care business; and (16) matters relating to the voluntary chapter 11 proceedings of the Company's subsidiary Aearo Technologies and certain of its affiliates. Changes in such assumptions or factors could produce significantly different results. A further description of these factors is located in the Reports under "Cautionary Note Concerning Factors That May Affect Future Results" and "Risk Factors" in Part I, Items 1 and 1A (Annual Report) and in Part I, Item 2 and Part II, Item 1A (Quarterly Reports). The Company assumes no obligation to update any forward-looking statements discussed herein as a result of new information or future events or developments.</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div id="i34eda43d2a1b465b865674bbbf065f7a_13"></div><div style="-sec-extract:summary"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:107%">Item 9.01. Financial Statements and Exhibits</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%">(d) colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div><span style="color:#0000ff;font-family:'Times New CERTAIN CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION HAS BEEN EXCLUDED FROM THE EXHIBIT BECAUSE IT IS&#58; (i) NOT MATERIAL AND (ii) IS A TYPE OF INFORMATION THAT THE REGISTRANT TREATS AS PRIVATE OR CONFIDENTIAL.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:80.17pt;padding-right:80.17pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">COMBAT ARMS SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.1pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This Master Settlement Agreement (&#8220;the Settlement&#8221; or the &#8220;MSA&#8221;), dated August 29, 2023 between&#58; (1) 3M Company (&#8220;3M&#8221;) and Aearo Technologies LLC, an acquired subsidiary of 3M (&#8220;Aearo&#8221;) (collectively, along with 3M Occupational Safety, Aearo Holding LLC, Aearo Intermediate LLC, and Aearo LLC, collectively (&#8220;Aearo&#8221;), and along with 3M, collectively &#8220;Defendants&#8221;)&#59; and (2) the undersigned Plaintiffs&#8217; Leadership in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">In re Combat Arms Earplug Products Liability Litigation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">, MDL No. 2885, U.S.D.C. for the Northern District of Florida (&#8220;MDL Court&#8221;)&#59; and (3) the undersigned Plaintiffs&#8217; Leadership in the Minnesota coordinated state court action pending in the 4th Judicial District, County of Hennepin, Minnesota, File No. 27-CV-19- 19916 (&#8220;MN Court&#8221;), collectively the &#8220;Negotiating Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel&#8221; (&#8220;NPC&#8221;). Defendants and the NPC are each a &#8220;Party,&#8221; and, together with the NPC, are the &#8220;Parties.&#8221;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This MSA reflects the Parties&#8217; intent and agreement to settle and fully resolve, to the greatest extent possible, all litigation and claims against Defendants that exist, have existed, or may exist in the future, which are related to, arise from, are caused by, or are in any way connected to the use of Combat Arms Earplugs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">All capitalized terms used herein shall have the meanings ascribed to them, respectively, either where they are first used (set off in parentheses and quotations) or where they appear in Article 1 below.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:80.15pt;padding-right:80.15pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">RECITALS</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;From 1999 to 2015, Aearo and then later 3M, manufactured, distributed, and&#47;or marketed Combat Arms Version 2 earplugs which were military-grade earplugs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:134.95pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3M acquired Aearo in 2008.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">C.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Individuals have asserted CAE Claims against Defendants, which Defendants dispute. Defendants deny liability for all CAE Claims.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:134.95pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">D.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The filed CAE Claims have been centralized in the MDL Court and in the MN</font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:134.95pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">E.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The Parties have concluded that, given the facts and circumstances of the CAE</font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.45pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Claims, including the claims asserted and the legal and factual defenses thereto, it would be in the Parties</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">&#8217; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">best interests to enter into this MSA to avoid the uncertainties, burdens, and risks of new</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">and continued litigation. The Parties further concluded that, based on, among other things, the total number of persons with CAE Claims and, separately, the number of persons with CAE Claims that the Parties believe will participate in the MSA, the Settlement is fair, reasonable, and adequate.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td in lieu of further litigation, all CAE Claims through this Settlement and proceedings in the MDL Court and the MN Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">H.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Nothing in the Settlement will be construed as evidence of, or as an admission by, Defendants of any fault, liability, wrongdoing, or damages whatsoever.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:98.95pt"><font dual-ended, non-linear earplugs sold or manufactured by or for or with either Aearo or 3M under any trade name, including but not limited to Combat Arms Earplugs (Version 2), ARC Plug earplugs, and AO and&#47;or use of the CAE.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New dollars.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Any and all past, present, and future rights, remedies, actions, claims, liabilities, losses, demands, causes of action, suits at law or in equity, arising under state or federal law, verdicts, suits of judgments and&#47;or liens, past, present, and future, and any fraudulent transfer, conveyance, and related types of claims, of any kind whatsoever regardless of the legal or equitable theory, whether known or unknown, whether sounding in contract or tort, whether asserted or unasserted in any litigation, or the jurisdiction where asserted. Claims also include, but are not limited to, all claims for damages or remedies of whatever kind or character, known or unknown, that are now recognized or that may be created or recognized in the future by statute, regulation,</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">judicial decision, or in any other manner, including but not limited to (i) personal injury and&#47;or bodily injury, latent injury, future injury, progression of existing injury, damage, disease, death, fear of death, disease or injury, mental or physical pain or suffering, emotional or mental harm, anguish, or loss of enjoyment of life or loss of life&#8217;s pleasures&#59; (ii) compensatory damages, general damages, special damages, punitive, exemplary, and statutory and other multiple damages or penalties of any kind&#59; (iii) loss of wages, income, earnings or earning capacity&#59; (iv) medical expenses, doctor, hospital, nursing, physical therapy or rehabilitation or other therapy and drug bills&#59; (v) loss of support, services, consortium, companionship, society or affection, or damage to familial relations, by spouses, former spouses, parents, children, other relatives or &#8220;significant others&#8221; of any Derivative Claimant&#59; (vi) consumer fraud, refunds, unfair business practices, deceptive trade practices, Unfair and Deceptive Acts and Practices, disgorgement of </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">2</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">profit, and other similar claims whether arising under statute, regulation, or judicial decision&#59; (vii) wrongful death and survivorship&#59; (viii) medical screening and monitoring&#59; (viii) injunctive and declaratory relief&#59; (ix) economic, property, or business losses&#59; (x) prejudgment or post-judgment interest&#59; (xi) attorneys&#8217; fees and costs&#59; and (xii) any class action or putative class action.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Days</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Days as defined in Rule 6 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Defendants</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; 3M Company, 3M Occupational Safety LLC, Aearo Holding LLC, Aearo Intermediate LLC, Aearo LLC, and Aearo Technologies LLC.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Defendants&#8217; Walkaway Rights</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The 98% Walkaway Right and the Wave Walkaway Right, collectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Derivative Claimant</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Any and all persons or entities who has or have a right to sue the Released Parties, independently, derivatively or otherwise, by reason of their personal relationship to an Eligible Claimant, and&#47;or otherwise by, through or under, or otherwise in relation to, the Eligible Claimant. Derivative Claimants include, but are not limited to, heirs, beneficiaries, surviving spouse (including, but not limited to, a putative or common law spouse), surviving domestic partner and&#47; or next of kin, if any, of an Eligible Claimant.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Eligible Claimant</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Any person with a CAE Claim, including but not limited to, CAE Claims filed in a complaint and&#47;or dismissed without prejudice in the MDL or the MN Court and&#47;or any and all Derivative Claimants. For the avoidance of doubt, any Person with a CAE Claim that was dismissed with prejudice prior to the Settlement Date is not an Eligible Claimant.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Expedited Payment Program</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The program for expedited payments to Eligible Claimants set forth in Article 10.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt;padding-right:119.55pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%;text-decoration:underline">Fairness Hearing</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%">&#58; The MDL Court hearing pursuant to 15 U.S.C. &#167; 77c(a)(10). </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%;text-decoration:underline">Final Registration Date</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%">&#58; The date set forth in Section 5.9.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Identification Order</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; An order entered by the MDL Court and the MN Court substantially in the form set forth in Exhibit 2 that requires CAE Counsel to provide information on all Eligible Claimants for whom they are Primary Counsel.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Identification Order Declaration</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; A declaration of Primary Counsel submitted pursuant to the Identification Order, as set forth in Exhibit 2.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Identification Order Report</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The report prepared by the Settlement Administrator identifying all Eligible Claimants listed on an Identification Order Declaration.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Indemnity Insurance</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Insurance policies issued to Defendants and&#47;or their affiliates that provide coverage for bodily or personal injury allegedly suffered by Eligible Claimants.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Indemnity Insurance Recovery</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Proceeds received by Defendants from any and all Indemnity Insurance.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Initial Registration Date</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The date on which Registration Forms are due as set forth in Section 5.4.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Interest</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; A lawyer shall be deemed to have an &#8220;Interest&#8221; in an Eligible Claimant if they (or the lawyer&#8217;s firm)&#58; (a) have an engagement or retainer agreement with such Eligible Claimant&#59; (b) are listed as the counsel of record for such Eligible Claimant, including for an Eligible Claimant whose case has been dismissed without prejudice&#59; (c) have entered a tolling </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">3</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">agreement for such Eligible Claimant&#59; (d) have entered an appearance for such Eligible Claimant&#59; (e) otherwise have any right or interest, whether fixed or contingent and whether paid or unpaid, resulting from representation of an Eligible Claimant, including, without limitation, a referral fee or referral agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, counsel appointed by the MDL Court or MN Court do not have an Interest in the CAE Claim(s) of an Eligible Claimant merely due to their appointment as leadership counsel or based on an actual or potential claim for compensation from any common benefit fee or cost fund.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Master Settlement Agreement or MSA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; This Master Settlement Agreement dated August 29, 2023 and all exhibits attached hereto.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MDL Court</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The United States District Court assigned by the Judicial Panel for Multidistrict Litigation for MDL No. 2885. The Plaintiffs&#8217; Executive Committee as appointed by the MDL Court&#58; Bryan Aylstock, Shelley Hutson, Chris Seeger, Brian Barr, Mike Burns, Evan Buxner, Paul Pennock, Thomas Cartmell, Tom Pirtle, Roberto Martinez, Sean Tracey, Doug Monsour, and Adam Wolfson.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MDL Administrative Docket</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The Docket established by the MDL Court pursuant to Pretrial Order #22 (ECF No. 898).</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MN Court</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The Hennepin County District Court overseeing all cases subject to the Order Companioning Cases filed on February 13, 2019, in State of Minnesota Court File Nos. 27-CV- 19-1412 and 27-CV-19-2017, as well as the February 22, 2021 Order Reassigning and Companioning Cases in State of Minnesota Court File No. 27-CV-19-19916.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MN Leadership</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Daniel Gustafson, Rick Paul, and William Sieben.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MSA II or Verdicts Settlement</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The Master Settlement Agreement for Verdicts Cases, dated August 29, 2023, as part of the global settlement to resolve all CAE Claims as contemplated by this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">MSA III or Waves Settlement</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The Master Settlement Agreement for Wave Cases, dated August 29, 2023, between the Parties, as part of the global settlement to resolve all CAE Claims as contemplated by this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:98.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">NPC&#8217;s Walkaway Right</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; NPC&#8217;s right to walk away from the MSA as set forth in Section</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">7.2.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Negotiating Plaintiffs&#8217; Counsel or NPC</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Bryan Aylstock, Chris Seeger, Clayton Clark, and</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Daniel Gustafson.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Non-Participating Claimants</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Eligible Claimants who complete a Registration Form and elect not to participate in any Settlement Program.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Non-Responding Claimants</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Eligible Claimants listed on an Identification Order Declaration who fail to submit a Registration Form.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Participation Level</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The percentage of Eligible Claimants whose cases are resolved through the MSA, as calculated in Article 6 and Exhibit 11.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Primary Counsel</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; CAE Counsel shall be deemed to be Primary Counsel in the following circumstances&#58; (1) for an Eligible Claimant with a filed case (including Eligible Claimants previously dismissed without prejudice who are represented), (a) if CAE Counsel is listed as the registering Law Firm in MDL-Centrality, or (b) if CAE Counsel is the counsel of record for any </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">4</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Eligible Claimant commenced in Minnesota&#59; or (2) for any Eligible Claimant with an unfiled CAE Claim, (a) if CAE Counsel has an engagement or retainer agreement with such Eligible Claimant, or (b) if CAE Counsel has entered into a tolling agreement for such Eligible Claimant. CAE Counsel shall not be Primary Counsel for Eligible Claimants dismissed without prejudice if CAE Counsel&#8217;s representation of that Eligible Claimant ended prior to the Settlement Date.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:66pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Qualified Settlement Fund or QSF</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The fund established pursuant to this MSA set up in accordance with Section 468B(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and 26 CFR &#167; 1.468B-1 1, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">et seq. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">of the Treasury Regulations.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">QSF Administrator</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; ARCHER Systems, LLC, the company retained to administer the QSF, and who shall act as the fiduciary of the settlement trust in accordance with the provisions of the Trust Agreement, the MSA, and Court Orders with specific powers to include retention of the trust estate, investments and preservation of principal, disbursements, payments of administrative expenses and costs, retention of investment advisors and other agents, consultation with counsel, execution of documents, litigation, and compliance with applicable law. Tax returns shall be completed by the MDL Court-appointed CPA, Randall Sansom.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Reference Date</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The date on which the Identification Orders require the submission of declarations by CAE Counsel identifying all Eligible Claimants (including Derivative Claimants) for which they are Primary Counsel.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Registered Claimant</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; An Eligible Claimant who has completed a Registration Form and elected to participate in the Settlement and provided an executed Release, as set forth in Exhibit 4, and a Stipulated Dismissal with Prejudice, as set forth in Exhibit 5.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Release</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The release, including indemnification and agreement to hold harmless, specified in Exhibit 4.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Released Claims</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Collectively, (i) Claims that any Releasing Party may have ever had, may now have or at any time hereafter may have against any Released Party and (ii) Liabilities that any Released Party may have ever had, may now have or at any time hereafter may have to any Releasing Party, in the case of clause (i) and clause (ii), to any extent, or in any way, arising out of, relating to, resulting from and&#47;or connected with the CAE or any other non-linear earplugs sold or manufactured by or for or with either Aearo or 3M under any trade name, including but not limited to Combat Arms Earplugs (Version 2), ARC Plug earplugs, and AO Safety Indoor Outdoor Range Earplugs, including but not limited to Combat Arms version 1, version 2, version 3, version 4, and version 4.1.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Released Parties</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; (i) Defendants and (ii) Defendants&#8217; past, present, and&#47;or future affiliates, assigns, predecessors, successors, related companies, subsidiary companies, directors, officers, employees, shareholders, advisors, advertisers, attorneys, insurers, and agents&#59; (iii) past, present, and&#47;or future manufacturers, suppliers of materials, suppliers of components, and all other persons involved in development, design, manufacture, formulation, testing, distribution, marketing, labeling, regulatory submissions, advertising and&#47;or sale of any Defendants&#8217; product or component thereof&#59; (iv) past, present, and&#47;or future distributors, licensees, retailers, sellers, and resellers of any CAE&#59; (v) all past, present and&#47;or future persons and entities that are indemnified by Defendants in connection with any CAE by contract or common law rights of indemnification or contribution&#59; and (vi) the respective past, present, and&#47;or future parents, subsidiaries, divisions, affiliates, joint venturers, predecessors, successors, assigns, transferees, insurers, shareholders (or the equivalent thereto), directors (or the equivalent thereto), officers (or the equivalent thereto), managers, principals, employees, consultants, advisors, attorneys, agents, servants, representatives, heirs, trustees, executors, estate administrators, and personal representatives (or the equivalent thereto) of the parties referred to in this paragraph.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">5</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:99pt;padding-right:92.35pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%">&#58; The resolution achieved through this Master Settlement Agreement. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement Administrator</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%">&#58; ARCHER Systems, LLC, as described in Article 9. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement Date</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:217%">&#58; The date on which the MSA is signed, August 29, 2023.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.45pt;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement Payment</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; A payment made to a Registered Claimant pursuant to the Settlement Program in return for a Release and a Stipulated Dismissal with Prejudice.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement Program or Program</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The process of receiving of consideration in exchange for providing a Release and a Stipulated Dismissal with Prejudice pursuant to this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Verdicts Cases</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The CAE cases that went to trial and obtained a verdict against Defendants prior to the Settlement Date, as listed on Exhibit 6 to this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.95pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Walkaway Right or Walkaway Rights</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The 98% Walkaway Right, the Wave Walkaway Right, and NPC&#8217;s Walkway Right.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Wave Walkaway Right</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; Defendants&#8217; right to walk away from the MSA based on the Wave Participation Level of Wave Cases as set forth in Section 7.1.2.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Wave Cases</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#58; The CAE Claims the MDL Court and MN Court identified for pre-trial discovery work-up prior to the Settlement Date, as listed on Exhibit 7 to this MSA. For avoidance of doubt, any such case previously dismissed with prejudice is not a Wave Case. The Parties agree that the entire list of Wave Cases is listed on Exhibit 7 to this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:83.3pt;padding-right:83.3pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 2 VERDICTS AND WAVE CASES</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Parties agree that the Verdicts Cases and Wave Cases shall be resolved in accordance with the Verdicts Settlement and the Wave Settlement. In the event that Defendants exercise the 98% Walkaway Right, the obligations set forth in the Verdicts Settlement and the Wave Settlement remain. For the avoidance of doubt, if Defendants walk away from the MSA pursuant to the 98% Walkaway Right, both Parties are still bound by the Verdicts Settlement and the Wave Settlement, including that the Releases, Stipulated Dismissals with Prejudice, and payments required to be exchanged in the Verdicts Settlement and the Waves Settlement must be made and cannot be revoked because Defendants exercised their 98% Walkaway Right.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:83.3pt;padding-right:83.3pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 3 ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Within ten (10) days of the Settlement Date, Defendants shall pay $10 million to fund administrative expenses connected with the Settlement. Such payment shall not be returned to Defendants in the event that Defendants exercise their Walkaway Rights.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:83.3pt;padding-right:83.3pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 4 IDENTIFICATION OF ELIGIBLE CLAIMANTS</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The purpose of the identification requirements set forth in this Article is to identify and create an initial list of the Eligible Claimants.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Identification Order</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">On the Settlement Date, the Parties shall jointly apply to the MDL Court and the MN Court for an Identification Order, substantially in the forms attached as Exhibit 2 (modified as needed to conform to local court practice), requiring each CAE Counsel to submit an Identification Order</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Declaration that identifies all Eligible Claimants for which they are Primary Counsel and for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">pro se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">litigants with CAE Claims to identify their CAE Claims, which shall apply to all CAE </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">6</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Counsel and to all </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">pro se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">litigants who have filed a CAE Claim, to MDL Centrality and serve the same Identification Order Declaration on Defendants, the MDL PEC, and MN Leadership via MDL Centrality or email or by such alternative means specified by the MN Court for cases under its jurisdiction.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:98.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The MDL Identification Order shall require each Primary Counsel to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Take any and all steps necessary to identify all Eligible Claimants they represent or claim to represent, and submit to MDL Centrality an Identification Order Declaration under penalty of perjury, that identifies all Eligible Claimants represented by that Primary Counsel (the &#8220;Identification Order Declaration&#8221;).</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Such declaration shall be in the form set forth in Exhibit 2 and shall include, for each Eligible Claimant, his or her name, address, email address, cell phone number, the Social Security number of the Eligible Claimant, the MDL Centrality Plaintiff Identification Number (if any), and the CAE case number (if the CAE Claim has been filed including if the case subsequently was dismissed without prejudice). The list of Eligible Claimants must be produced in a digital format.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">For the avoidance of doubt and consistent with the definition, an Eligible Claimant includes an individual with any CAE Claim regardless of whether the CAE Claim has been filed in the MDL Court or the MN Court or any other court, or has been tolled, or has been dismissed without prejudice from any court. For the avoidance of doubt, CAE Claims that have been dismissed with prejudice prior to the Settlement Date are not Eligible Claimants.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1.3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Primary Counsel is required to identify each and every Eligible Claimant for which they are Primary Counsel regardless of whether such Eligible Claimant intends to participate in the Settlement.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1.4&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Each Identification Order Declaration shall be submitted to MDL Centrality and through such means as directed by the MN Court no later than fourteen (14) days after the Identification Order is issued, and shall be served on the Parties, and the Settlement Administrator. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Pro se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Eligible Claimants shall be required to submit a declaration within the same time period and shall serve such declaration on the Parties and the Settlement Administrator in the same manner.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.1.5&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">In so identifying Eligible Claimants, each Primary Counsel and any pro se Eligible Claimants, shall certify in the Identification Order Declaration, under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States and of any relevant state, that s&#47;he has identified all Eligible Claimants for which they are Primary Counsel and that each identified Eligible Claimant is in compliance with the obligations imposed by the Identification Order</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.2 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Settlement Administrator shall provide the MDL Court and MN Court with the combined list from all of the Identification Order Declarations.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.3 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">All Eligible Claimants listed on an Identification Order Declaration with filed CAE Claims, including CAE Claims filed on the MDL Administrative Docket, must continue to comply with all MDL Court or MN Court orders concerning the timely production of complete census and DD214 forms.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Similarly, all Eligible Claimants listed on an Identification Order Declaration with filed CAE Claims, including CAE Claims filed on the MDL Administrative Docket, are not relieved of and must comply with the obligations set forth in CMO 57 and the equivalent case management order in the MN Court. To the extent a case is filed, removed to, or transferred into this Court between the date of this Order and the Reference Date as defined in the CMO 60 (the Identification Order), and is later identified pursuant to the Identification Order, CMO 57 shall </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">7</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">no longer apply. However, should such case not be so identified under CMO 60, the obligations and deadlines set forth in CMO 57 remain in full force and effect.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.25pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.4 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Eligible Claimants listed on an Identification Order Declaration whose CAE Claims were dismissed without prejudice and have not been refiled must file a short form complaint in the MDL Court or the MN Court, ten days after they are identified on an Identification Order Declaration, and such complaint must be accompanied by the DD214 forms (if not active duty) and a completed Plaintiff Fact Sheet as required by CMO 57 and the equivalent case management order in the MN Court. Cases filed under this subsection must comply with all MDL and MN Court orders, including CMO 57 and the equivalent case management order in the MN Court. To the greatest extent of the applicable law, for any case filed or served after the Settlement Date in any state other than the State of Minnesota, Defendants shall promptly remove the case to the applicable United States District Court and tag such case for transfer to the MDL Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.5 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">For any case on the Identification Order Declaration that has been tolled or that has been served, but not filed, or has otherwise not been filed for any reason, CAE Counsel shall be required to file the case within ten (10) days in the MDL Court or the MN Court. To the extent permitted by CMO 59 and the equivalent case management order in the MN Court, such claims may be filed on the MDL Administrative Docket. Further, to the greatest extent of the applicable law, for any case filed or served after the Settlement Date in any state other than the State of Minnesota, Defendants shall promptly remove the case to the applicable United States District Court and tag such case for transfer to the MDL Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.6 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Any Eligible Claimant with a currently filed case that is not included on the Identification Order Declaration shall be subject to dismissal with prejudice, consistent with CMO 60 and the equivalent case management order in the MN Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.7 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Failure by CAE Counsel to comply with the Identification Order shall subject CAE Counsel to potential sanctions by either the MDL Court or the MN Court or both. Any CAE Claim not identified in an Identification Order Declaration in response to the Identification Order that should have been included, but was not, shall be subject to being dismissed with prejudice by the MDL Court or the MN Court (where such CAE Claim has been filed in either Court, including on the MDL Court&#8217;s Administrative Docket). This provision shall apply to an Eligible Claimant not identified in an Identification Order Declaration whose case is later filed and&#47;or served in the MDL Court or the MN Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.1.8 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">CAE Counsel and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">pro se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Eligible Claimants have an ongoing duty to update the Identification Order Declarations provided in response to the Identification Order if and when, for example, an individual&#8217;s personal information is incorrect or outdated.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">The Reference Date</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Reference Date is the date by which CAE Counsel must submit the Identification Order Declaration. The Reference Date may be extended by agreement of the Parties or order of the MDL Court or the MN Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 4.3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">The Identification Order Report</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Brown Greer, subject to appointment by the MDL Court and in consultation with the MN Court, shall be the Settlement Data Administrator (&#8220;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Settlement Data Administrator</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#8221;) and shall provide reports related to the Identification Order.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Within fifteen (15) days of the Reference Date, the Settlement Data Administrator will
