Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Defendants will pay up to $200 million on July 15, 2029, with the specific amount as determined by the conditions in Confidential Exhibit 10.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 11.10.4&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The payments in this Section will not be made if either Party exercises a Walkaway Right.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 11.11 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Participation Level Deadlines</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The deadline for Plaintiffs to achieve the Participation Levels set forth in the MSA shall be July 15, 2030, provided neither Party has exercised its Walkaway Rights (the &#8220;Deadline&#8221;). This Deadline may be extended for up to one year by request of either Party. If this Deadline is extended, then the deadlines for the Reserve Funds set forth in Sections 11.10 will each be extended for the same amount of time.</font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">26</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 11.12 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Cash and Equity Payments</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Defendants may, in their sole discretion, substitute the monetary amount to be employed in the numerator for each stock tranche (i.e. $350 million for the stock issuance in Section 11.4.1) for the issuance of stock that Defendants are obligated to make under this Article. For the avoidance of doubt, in the event that 3M is unable to issue Common Stock pursuant to 15 U.S.C.</font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#167; 77c(a)(10), the Parties shall meet and confer in good faith to discuss how to provide consideration of equivalent value, but 3M cannot be required to substitute cash for stock under this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 11.13 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Payment Deadlines</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">For the deadline provided for any cash payment Defendants are obligated to make under this Article 11 or any other Article under the Agreement, Defendants may delay that deadline by up to ninety (90) days, but upon so doing Defendants must also pay interest on any amount not paid at the Wall Street Journal prime rate plus 2.5 percent.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:80.2pt;padding-right:80.2pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 12</font></div><div style="padding-left:80.17pt;padding-right:80.17pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">LIMITATIONS ON DEFENDANTS&#8217; FUNDING OBLIGATIONS</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Any term of this Settlement to the contrary notwithstanding, Defendants shall have no financial obligation under this Settlement other than its express obligations to make payments and&#47;or issuance of stock in each case as described in Article 3 and Article 11. Defendants shall have no obligation to pay (or to make any payment on account of) or reimburse any Registered Claimant or CAE Counsel for any fees, costs or expenses incurred by such Registered Claimant or CAE Counsel in connection with the Settlement. The Defendants shall have no responsibility for the management of Common Stock issued under this Agreement or any liability to any Eligible Claimant arising from the handling of claims by the Special Master and&#47;or the Claims Administrator.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:202.05pt;padding-right:198.25pt;text-indent:60pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 13 QUALIFIED SETTLEMENT FUND</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 13.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Qualified Settlement Fund</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 13.1.1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">In accordance with the terms of this Settlement, the payments by 3Mshall be deposited into the QSF and shall remain the property of the QSF. The Settlement Funds within the Qualified Settlement Fund will be held in a fiduciary capacity.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 13.1.2 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Qualified Settlement Fund shall comply with Treasury Regulation Section 1.468B-1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">et seq. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">regarding taxation and tax reporting obligations. The Qualified Settlement Fund shall be deemed to be in the custody of the MDL Court. The Qualified Settlement Fund shall remain subject to the jurisdiction of the MDL Court until such Settlement Funds are distributed in their entirety and upon further order of the MDL Court in consultation with the MN Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:263.55pt;padding-right:263.55pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 14 LIENS</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 14.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Liens</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 14.1.1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Potential liens for Registered Claimants shall be negotiated by Settlement Administrator ARCHER, already appointed by the MDL Court, in consultation with the MN Court, as the Lien Resolution Administrator, on behalf of Registered Claimants. All known liens related to Registered Claimants&#8217; use of 3M CAE will be paid out of the proceeds of the </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">27</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Settlement and are Registered Claimants&#8217; responsibility to pay. Nothing herein is intended to, nor should be construed as, creating a right of reimbursement for lienholders of obligations upon Registered Claimants or Registered Claimants&#8217; CAE Counsel where none would otherwise exist under applicable state or federal law.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 14.1.2 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Claimants agree to satisfy any Medicare, Medicaid and other governmental authority liens. To fulfill this obligation, Registered Claimants&#8217; Counsel, by and through the Lien Resolution Administrator, must determine whether each Registered Claimant is Medicare&#47;Medicaid eligible or a Medicare&#47;Medicaid beneficiary. If the Lien Resolution Administrator determines that a Medicare&#47;Medicaid lien is being asserted, it shall certify to Registered Claimants&#8217; Counsel&#58; (1) the amount to resolve such lien as established by the agreement of the Lien Resolution Administrator and the appropriate government agency&#59; and (2) the &#8220;holdback&#8221; amount agreed to by the appropriate government agency that would allow for partial release of funds from the QSF.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 14.1.3 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">In any event and any term of this Settlement to the contrary notwithstanding, satisfaction and discharge of any and all liens, whether past, present or future, whether known or unknown asserted or unasserted, with respect to any Settlement Payment (and&#47;or the right to receive any Settlement Payment) are the sole responsibility of the relevant Registered Claimant and their respective CAE Counsel.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 14.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Defendants&#8217; Funding Obligations</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">For the avoidance of doubt, the conditions precedent in this Section are not conditions precedent to Defendants&#8217; funding obligations into the QSF, but are only conditions precedent to the distribution of any funds withheld from the Registered Claimant&#8217;s Settlement Payments(s) from the QSF to the Registered Claimant.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:243.55pt;padding-right:243.55pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-0.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 15 ATTORNEYS&#8217; FEES</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 15.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Individual Counsel Attorneys&#8217; Fees</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This agreement does not alter any contractual obligation between lawyers and clients regarding attorneys&#8217; fees.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 15.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Common Benefit Fund</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Work performed and expenses incurred for the benefit of all CAE Claimants as defined more fully in the MDL Court&#8217;s Common Benefit Orders and the MN Court&#8217;s Common Benefit Orders shall be paid from the Common Benefit Fund. Payments are subject to procedures set in place by the MDL Court and&#47;or the MN Court now or in the future. The Common Benefit Assessment as set forth in the MDL Court&#8217;s Orders and the MN Court&#8217;s Orders in place now or in the future shall be held back by the QSF Administrator on a per Registered Claimant&#8217;s basis with payments due to the Common Benefit Fund by QSF Administrator on a quarterly basis. QSF Administrator must provide proof of compliance to the Settlement Special Master, MDL Leadership Counsel, MN Leadership, the MN Court, and the MDL Court.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 15.3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">No Additional Payments by Defendants</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">For the avoidance of doubt, Defendants shall have no obligation to pay additional sums for attorneys&#8217; fees or costs, including pursuant to any fee petition, beyond the amount set forth in Article 3 and Article 11 of this MSA, and such claims for attorneys&#8217; fees and costs being released by Registered Claimants.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">28</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:256.1pt;padding-right:256.1pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-0.05pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 16 BANKRUPTCY</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 16.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Bankruptcy</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">3M has no present intention to file a petition for relief under the Bankruptcy Code. In the event it does so in the future, the following provisions shall apply&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">3M shall list on its schedules of liabilities the claims of all Registered Claimants whose payments are outstanding under this MSA as of the date of any such bankruptcy filing as liquidated, non-contingent, and undisputed per this MSA without prejudice to such Registered Claimants&#8217; ability to file proofs of claim against 3M on account of their Released Claims. For the avoidance of doubt, any Registered Claimants whose payments are complete under this MSA, including all Registered Claimants who elected the Expedited Payment Program, shall not be so scheduled.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">To the extent 3M obtains relief as against any such Registered Claimants whose payments are outstanding under this MSA pursuant to 11 U.S.C. &#167; 550 in respect of payments made on account of such Registered Claimants&#8217; Claims, such recoveries shall be limited to a credit against unpaid amounts due to such Registered Claimants under this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">If this MSA is not assumed in bankruptcy or adopted as part of a confirmed Chapter 11 plan of reorganization, 3M hereby waives any statute of limitations defense that might limit or hinder recovery by Registered Claimants whose payments are outstanding under this MSA, except to the extent such defenses exist as of the Settlement Date.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Subject to the other subparts of Paragraph 12.1.1, if 3M obtains relief as against Registered Claimants whose payments are outstanding under this MSA pursuant to 11 U.S.C. &#167; 550 or if this MSA is not assumed in bankruptcy or adopted as part of a confirmed Chapter 11 plan of reorganization, then all agreements, all concessions, all reductions of such Registered Claimants&#8217; Released Claims, and the Release, contained in this MSA shall immediately and automatically be deemed null and void as to 3M&#59; such Registered Claimants shall be deemed immediately and automatically restored to the same position they were in immediately prior to their entry into the MSA&#59; and the Registered Claimants shall have the right to assert any and all claims against 3M in the bankruptcy proceeding or otherwise, subject to any automatic stay, without regard to any limits or agreements as to the amount of the Settlement otherwise provided in the Settlement Agreement&#59; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">provided, however</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">, that notwithstanding the foregoing sentence, (i) all reductions of Registered Claimants&#8217; Released Claims, and the Release and Covenant Not to Sue provided in connection with such settled Claims contained in this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect as to all Persons other than 3M itself&#59; (ii) in the event a Releasing Party asserts any Released Claim against 3M after the rejection and&#47;or termination of the MSA and receives a judgment, settlement, or distribution arising from such Released Claim, then the amount of any payments such Releasing Party has previously received from 3M under the Settlement Agreement shall be applied to reduce the amount of any such judgment, settlement, or distribution&#59; (iii) such Registered Claimants may exercise all rights provided under the Bankruptcy Code (or other applicable bankruptcy or non- bankruptcy law) with respect to their Released Claims against 3M, subject to all defenses and rights of 3M&#59; and (iv) such Registered Claimants shall retain all payments previously received under this MSA, subject to 11 U.S.C. &#167; 550.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 16.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Aearo Debtors</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">If Aearo Debtors as defined in the Petition for Bankruptcy, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">In re Aearo Techs. LLC</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">, Case No. 22-02890 (JJG) (Bankr. S.D. Ind.), commence a case under chapter 11 of the Bankruptcy Code on or after the date of this MSA, such case shall be filed in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of Indiana.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:4.020%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.5pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">29</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:69.12pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:123.57pt;padding-right:123.57pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-0.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">ARTICLE 17 MISCELLANEOUS</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.1&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Tax Consequences</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.45pt;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Neither Eligible Claimants nor Defendants (nor CAE Counsel nor Defendants&#8217; Counsel) makes any representation regarding the tax consequences of this settlement.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.2&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">No Presumption as to Drafting</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This MSA is the product of arm&#8217;s-length negotiations between the Parties. No Party shall be deemed to be the drafter of this MSA or any provision thereof. No presumption shall be deemed to exist in favor of or against any party as a result of the preparation or negotiation of this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.3&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Not Affected By Change In Law</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This MSA shall be binding on the Parties regardless of any change in the law that might occur after the date the Parties execute this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.4&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Entire Agreement</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This MSA and all exhibits hereto constitute the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this MSA, and there are no other written or oral agreements, understandings, or arrangements except as set forth herein (including references to MSA II and MSA III). This MSA supersedes and replaces any prior agreement or writing between the Parties. The Parties understand, agree, and acknowledge that no promises, representations, understandings, or warranties have been made by any Party or relied upon as an inducement for entering into this MSA, except as contained herein, and that this MSA constitutes the full statement of any agreement between the Parties.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The terms of this MSA may not be modified or waived except in writing, signed by the Parties hereto. The Parties hereby acknowledge that they have read this MSA and had an opportunity to obtain the advice of competent counsel of their choosing regarding it. As such, the Parties hereby also acknowledge that they understand the terms of this MSA, and that they freely and voluntarily sign and enter into it. The Parties further acknowledge that, in entering into this Agreement, they have not relied upon any statement or representation by or on behalf of the other Party, except as stated herein.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.5&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Governing Law</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This Settlement is being executed and delivered, and is intended to be performed in the MDL Court. Recognizing there are some matters solely within the MN Court, nothing in this MSA is intended to limit the jurisdiction of the MN Court. The substantive laws of the State of New York shall govern the validity, construction, enforcement, and interpretation of this Settlement. Each of the Parties to this Settlement shall bear its own attorneys&#8217; fees and costs incurred in connection with the drafting and negotiation of this MSA, and in connection with all proceedings in the MDL Court and the MN Court, including all appeals of decisions from those courts.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.6&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Headings</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The headings used herein are for reference only and shall not affect the construction of this</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New This MSA shall not be assignable by any Party hereto without prior written consent of the other party or as otherwise expressly set forth in this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.5pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.9&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Amendment or Waiver</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">This MSA shall not be modified in any respect, except by a writing executed by all Parties to this MSA. The waiver of any rights conferred by this MSA shall be effective only if made in writing by the waiving party. The waiver by any Party of any breach of this MSA shall not be deemed or construed as a waiver of any other breach, whether prior to, subsequent to, or contemporaneous with this MSA.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.10 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Electronic Signatures</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Electronic signatures shall be accepted for execution of any settlement document required of Eligible Claimants or Eligible Claimants&#8217; Counsel. style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Neither this MSA, nor any exhibit, document, or instrument delivered hereunder, nor any statement, transaction, or proceeding in connection with the negotiation, execution, or implementation of this Settlement, is intended to be or shall be construed as or deemed to be evidence of an admission or concession by Defendants of any fault, liability, wrongdoing, or damages, or of the truth of any allegations asserted by any plaintiff or claimant against it, including by any Eligible Claimant or Derivative Claimant, or as an admission by any Eligible Claimant or Derivative Claimant of any lack of merit in their CAE Claim.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">No Party or Registered Claimant shall seek to introduce and&#47;or offer the terms of this Settlement, any statement, transaction, or proceeding in connection with the negotiation, execution, execution, or implementation of this Settlement, or any statements in the documents delivered in connection with this Settlement, or otherwise rely on the terms of this Settlement, in any judicial proceeding, except insofar as necessary to enforce the terms of this Settlement or Release provided pursuant to the Settlement, in connection with the determination of any income tax liability of a party, or in relation to any instrument executed and delivered pursuant to this Settlement (including any Registration Form and the executed attachments thereto). If a person seeks to introduce and&#47;or offer any of the matters described herein in any proceeding against Defendants or any of the Released Parties, the restrictions of this section shall not be applicable to Defendants with respect to that person.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3.95pt;padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.14 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Cooperation Public Statements</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Parties may, at their discretion, issue publicity, press releases, or other public statements regarding this Settlement, whether unilaterally or as jointly agreed to in writing by all Parties. Any jointly agreed or other statement shall not limit Defendants&#8217; ability to provide information about the Settlement to their employees, accountants, attorneys, insurers, shareholders, investors, analysts, or other stakeholders or in accordance with legal requirements or to limit any Party&#8217;s ability to provide notice or information about the MSA to Eligible Claimants or in accordance with legal requirements.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.15 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Payment Flexibility</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">If the number of Eligible Claimants who Register for the Expedited Payment Program exceeds 50% of the Eligible Claimants, the Parties will meet and confer in good faith to discuss accelerating payments to fund the Expedited Payment Program.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:99pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Section 17.16 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">Confidentiality about Settlement Negotiations</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">The Parties shall keep confidential the content of the negotiations, points of discussion, documents, communications, and supporting data utilized or prepared in connection with the </font></div><div style="height:61.92pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">CASE MANAGEMENT ORDER NO. 60</font></div><div style="padding-left:80.15pt;padding-right:80.15pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">(Identification Order)</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.1pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">In accordance with the terms of the Combat Arms Master Settlement Agreement (&#8220;MSA&#8221;), </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline"><a href="#i90fc20081a1947c78f668d128e41ff3b_4" style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;text-decoration:none;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</a></font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%"> the Court hereby enters this Identification Order.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline"><a href="#i90fc20081a1947c78f668d128e41ff3b_4" style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;text-decoration:none;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</a></font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%"> This Order requires all CAE Counsel for all Eligible Claimants for which they are Primary Counsel and all </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants to provide information to the Court in the format set forth below </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">by no later than September 12th </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">(the &#8220;Reference Date&#8221;).</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">___________________________</font></div><div style="margin-top:5.8pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-4.2pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> All capitalized terms have the same meaning as in the MSA. The MSA is available on the Court&#8217;s public website for the 3M MDL, https&#58;&#47;&#47;www.flnd.uscourts.gov&#47;3m-products-liability- litigation-mdl-no-2885.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6.05pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-4.2pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> The Court understands that Judge Laurie Miller, the presiding judge over CAE Claims pending in the 4th Judicial District, County of Hennepin, Minnesota, will be issuing a similar order, consistent with the MSA.</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.65pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">37</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:20.16pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">The MSA defines Eligible Claimant. This Order addresses a fundamental requirement of Primary Counsel for Eligible Claimants and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants in connection with this litigation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">CAE Counsel shall be deemed to be Primary Counsel in the following circumstances&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:134.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;for an Eligible Claimant with a filed case on the MDL docket (administrative or active) and Minnesota docket, including Eligible Claimants previously dismissed without prejudice who are represented&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:170.95pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:114%">a.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if CAE Counsel is listed as the registering Law Firm in MDL-</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.1pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:170.95pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Centrality, or</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:170.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">b.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if CAE Counsel is the counsel of record for any Eligible Claimant filed and&#47;or served in Minnesota&#59; or</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:134.9pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;for any Eligible Claimant with an unfiled CAE Claim&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:170.95pt;padding-right:66pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">a.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if CAE Counsel has an engagement or retainer agreement with such Eligible Claimant, as of the Reference Date&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:170.95pt;padding-right:67.35pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36.05pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">b.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if Counsel has entered into a tolling agreement for such Eligible Claimant.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">CAE Counsel shall not be Primary Counsel for Eligible Claimants dismissed without prejudice if CAE Counsel&#8217;s representation of that Eligible Claimant ended prior to the Reference Date.</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:134.95pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">I.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;IDENTIFICATION OF ELIGIBLE CLAIMANTS.</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.65pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">38</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:20.16pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Each CAE Counsel shall take any and all reasonable steps necessary to identify all of the Eligible Claimants for which they are Primary Counsel, whether or not those claimants have a filed case. For the avoidance of doubt, an Eligible Claimant includes an individual represented by counsel who seeks to pursue CAE Claims regardless of whether the Eligible Claims have been filed and&#47;or served in the MDL Court or the Minnesota Court, or any other court, or on the Administrative Docket, or have been tolled or have been dismissed without prejudice from any court.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline"><a href="#i90fc20081a1947c78f668d128e41ff3b_4" style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:9.1pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%;position:relative;text-decoration:none;top:-4.89pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</a></font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:232%">However, plaintiffs asserting CAE Claims that have been dismissed with prejudice prior to the Settlement Date are not Eligible Claimants.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants who have filed CAE Claims, whether in the MDL Court, the Minnesota Court, or on the Administrative Docket, shall also submit the information set forth below concerning their own case by the Reference Date.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:134.95pt;padding-right:65.9pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">II.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;SERVICE OF SWORN DECLARATION IDENTIFYING ALL ELIGIBLE CLAIMANTS.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">All CAE Counsel must submit a Declaration (the &#8220;Identification Order Declaration&#8221; or &#8220;Declaration&#8221;) </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">via </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">MDL Centrality, executed under penalty of perjury, that identifies all of CAE Counsel&#8217;s Eligible Claimants.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">____________________________________</font></div><div style="margin-top:5.8pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.45pt;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:7.8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-4.2pt;vertical-align:baseline">3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">CMO 57 at &#182; 5 and Section 4.1.4 of the MSA regarding additional requirements for cases previously dismissed without prejudice.</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">For all CAE Counsel, such Declaration shall be in substantially the form set forth in Exhibit &#8220;A&#8221; attached hereto and shall include in both hard copy and EXCEL format, for each Eligible Claim, the following information&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the name of the Eligible Claimant</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.55pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the address of the Eligible Claimant</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the Eligible Claimant&#8217;s Date of Birth</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the Eligible Claimant&#8217;s SSN</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the Eligible Claimant&#8217;s cellular phone number</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">The Eligible Claimant&#8217;s email address, if any, and</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the Court in which the Eligible Claimant&#8217;s case has been filed (if the case has been filed)</font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the active or administrative docket number (if the case has been filed, including if the case was subsequently dismissed without prejudice)</font></div><div style="padding-left:37.05pt;text-indent:-3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:164%">&#9744; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:164%">the MDL Centrality Plaintiff ID number (if the Eligible Claimant has ever been registered as an MDL Plaintiff via MDL Centrality)</font></div><div style="margin-top:1.2pt;padding-left:63.05pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:232%">The obligation to identify all Eligible Claimants for which CAE Counsel is Primary Counsel applies regardless of whether the Eligible Claimants intend to participate in the MSA.</font></div><div style="padding-left:63.1pt;padding-right:65.65pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants with CAE Claims filed in the MDL Court, the Minnesota Court, or on the Administrative Docket must submit, via MDL Centrality,</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.65pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">40</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:20.16pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">a declaration, executed under penalty of perjury, with the information set forth above concerning their own case. For all </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants, such Declaration shall be in substantially the same form set for in Exhibit B.</font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.7pt;text-align:right;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">After CAE Counsel and any </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants comply with the obligations of this Identification Order, each Eligible Claimant shall have the opportunity to Register for the MSA, by which they will indicate their intention to opt in to the settlement procedures set forth in the Registration Forms and agreeing to receive certain money in exchange for a release and dismissal with prejudice, provide a Release to Defendants, and be bound, with their CAE Counsel, to all terms of the MSA. As set forth in the MSA, through the submission of the Registration Form by or on behalf of an Eligible Claimant, all CAE Counsel with an Interest in that Eligible Claimant agree to the obligations on CAE Counsel set forth in the MSA. As indicated above, in identifying Eligible Claimants in the referenced Declaration, all CAE Counsel and any </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants with CAE Claims, shall certify, under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States and of any relevant state, that he&#47;she has identified all Eligible Claimants in which CAE Counsel serves as Primary Counsel (or, in the case of a </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimant, the Eligible Claimant&#8217;s own case) and that each identified Eligible Claimant is in compliance with the obligations imposed by this Identification Order. CAE Counsel and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants have an ongoing duty to update all of the information</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.65pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">41</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:20.16pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">required under this Order including, for example, when the personal information for an Eligible Claimant is incorrect or outdated (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">see </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Section III). Any updated information must be served within seven (7) days of learning of such updated information, and shall be served on the Court-appointed Settlement Data Administrator through MDL Centrality who shall promptly provide such information to the Court-Appointed Settlement Administrator. All information required by this Order is necessary so that the Court-appointed Settlement Administrator can properly and timely communicate with each Eligible Claimant and their Primary Counsel regarding their opportunity to participate in the MSA via the Registration Form. In the Court&#8217;s view, it is imperative to the success of this settlement program that the Settlement Administrator have an open and direct line of communication with every Eligible Claimant.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.05pt;padding-left:134.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">III.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;DEADLINE TO FILE DECLARATION IDENTIFYING ALL ELIGIBLE CLAIMANTS WITH THE COURT.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:62.95pt;padding-right:65.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Each Declaration required under this Order shall be submitted to the Court- appointed Settlement Data Administrator </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">via </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">MDL Centrality no later than the Reference Date, which deadline is fourteen (14) days after this Order is issued (September 12, 2023), and shall be served on the MDL PEC, MN Counsel, and the Defendants </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">via </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">MDL Centrality. The </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants shall be required to file a Declaration (</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">see </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Exhibit B) regarding their Eligible Claim within the same time period and shall serve such Declaration on the MDL PEC, MN Counsel, and the</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="margin-top:0.65pt;padding-left:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">42</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:20.16pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.85pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Defendants in the same manner. CAE Counsel and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Pro Se </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Eligible Claimants must update the Settlement Administrator within 14 days of receipt of any changed personal or contact information.</font></div><div style="padding-left:134.95pt;padding-right:65.8pt;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">IV.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;SANCTIONS FOR CAE COUNSEL&#8217;S FAILURE TO INCLUDE ALL ELIGIBLE CLAIMANTS ON DECLARATION.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:63pt;padding-right:65.65pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:35.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">Failure by CAE Counsel to include on the referenced Declaration all Eligible Claimants in which CAE Counsel is Primary Counsel will be a violation of this Order and shall subject (i) such unidentified CAE Claimants to dismissal with prejudice and (ii) CAE Counsel to potential sanctions by either the MDL Court or the Minnesota Court or both. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:232%">NOTE&#58; These Declarations are critical to the Court&#8217;s ability to effectively administer the settlement program through the Court-appointed Settlement Administrator and the Court-appointed Settlement Data Administrator, and manage the MDL docket. There will be NO notices of deficiency and no opportunities to cure for the failure to timely submit a Declaration. In the event that either the MDL PEC, MN Counsel, or the Defendants believe that a Declaration submitted pursuant to this Order is in violation of this Order, they shall notify the Court and provide such information, including information from the Settlement Administrator, as may establish the violation.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.15pt;padding-left:99pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">SO ORDERED</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">, on this </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">    </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> day of August, 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.45pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="padding-left:243pt"><img alt="image_5a.jpg" src="image_5a.jpg" style="height:1px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:336px"></div><div style="margin-top:0.15pt;padding-left:242.95pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">M. style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">DECLARATION OF CAE COUNSEL</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;text-decoration:underline">PURSUANT TO IDENTIFICATION ORDER</font></div><div style="margin-top:0.5pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:4.45pt;padding-left:98.95pt;padding-right:71.6pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:233%">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;My name is &#91;INSERT NAME OF CAE COUNSEL&#93;, and I am an attorney at &#91;INSERT NAME OF LAW FIRM&#93; (collectively &#8220;CAE Counsel&#8221;).</font></div><div style="padding-left:98.95pt;padding-right:71.75pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;I submit this Declaration in accordance with the Combat Arms Settlement Agreement and the Court&#8217;s Identification Order on behalf of myself and my firm.</font></div><div style="padding-left:98.95pt;padding-right:71.6pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-36pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:232%">3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Attached hereto is the chart that identifies all Eligible Claimants in which I or my firm are Primary Counsel, as defined in the Master Settlement Agreement. The attached chart will be timely served in both hard copy and in EXCEL format to MDL-Centrality in conformance with the Identification Order, and contains, to the best of my knowledge, the required demographic and contact information regarding my firms&#8217; Eligible Clients in which I or my firm are Primary Counsel.</font></div><div style="height:77.04pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:6.910%"><tr><td 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:top"><div style="margin-top:2.9pt;padding-left:161.7pt;padding-right:161.7pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:16pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">A</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New
